00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to debug exception handler
00044  *
00045  */

00047 #ifndef __CVMX_DEBUG_H__
00048 #define __CVMX_DEBUG_H__
00049 
00050 #include "cvmx-core.h"
00051 #include "cvmx-spinlock.h"
00052 
00053 #define CVMX_DEBUG_MAX_REQUEST_SIZE 1024 + 34   /* Enough room for setting memory of 512 bytes. */
00054 #define CVMX_DEBUG_MAX_RESPONSE_SIZE 1024 + 5
00055 
00056 #define CVMX_DEBUG_GLOBALS_BLOCK_NAME "cvmx-debug-globals"
00057 #define CVMX_DEBUG_GLOBALS_VERSION 6
00058 
00059 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00060 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00061 extern "C" {
00062 /* *INDENT-ON* */

00064 
00065 void cvmx_debug_init(void);
00066 void cvmx_debug_finish(void);
00067 void cvmx_debug_trigger_exception(void);
00068 
00069 extern uint32_t __cvmx_debug_is_octeon3;
00070 
00071 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_TOOLCHAIN
00072 extern int __octeon_debug_booted;
00073 
00074 static inline int cvmx_debug_booted(void)
00075 {
00076     return __octeon_debug_booted;
00077 }
00078 #else
00079 
00080 static inline int cvmx_debug_booted(void)
00081 {
00082     return cvmx_sysinfo_get()->bootloader_config_flags & CVMX_BOOTINFO_CFG_FLAG_DEBUG;
00083 }
00084 #endif
00085 /* There are 64 TLB entries in CN5XXX and 32 TLB entries in CN3XXX and
00086    128 TLB entries in CN6XXX. TLB entries increased to 256 in Octeon3 70xx and 78xx*/
00087 #define CVMX_DEBUG_N_TLB_ENTRIES 256
00088 /* Maximium number of hardware breakpoints/watchpoints allowed */
00089 #define CVMX_DEBUG_MAX_OCTEON_HW_BREAKPOINTS 4
00090 typedef struct {
00091     /* 0 means the core is not the focus core or no controlled.  Otherwise the value
00092        is equal to cvmx_debug_command_t */
00093     volatile uint64_t remote_controlled;
00094     uint64_t regs[32];
00095     /*mpy_regs are product registers P0-P5 and MPL0-MPL5(Octeon3 added p3-p5 and MPL3-MPL5) */
00096     uint64_t mpy_regs[12];
00097     /*fp_regs are floating point registers f0-f31 */
00098     uint64_t fp_regs[32];
00099     uint64_t lo;
00100     uint64_t hi;
00101 
00102 #define CVMX_DEBUG_BASIC_CONTEXT                \
00103     F(remote_controlled);                       \
00104     {   int i;                                  \
00105         for (i = 0; i < 32; i++)                \
00106             F(regs[i]);                         \
00107     }                                           \
00108     {   int i;                                  \
00109         for (i = 0; i < 12; i++)                 \
00110             F(mpy_regs[i]);                         \
00111     }                                           \
00112     F(lo);                                      \
00113     F(hi);
00114 
00115 #define CVMX_DEBUG_FP_CONTEXT                   \
00116     {   int i;                                  \
00117         for (i = 0; i < 32; i++)                \
00118             F(fp_regs[i]);                      \
00119     } 
00120     struct {
00121         uint64_t index;
00122         uint64_t entrylo[2];
00123         uint64_t entryhi;
00124         uint64_t pagemask;
00125         uint64_t status;
00126         uint64_t badvaddr;
00127         uint64_t cause;
00128         uint64_t config[4];
00129         uint64_t depc;
00130         uint64_t desave;
00131         uint64_t debug;
00132         uint64_t multicoredebug;
00133         uint64_t perfval[2];
00134         uint64_t perfctrl[2];
00135     } cop0;
00136 
00137 #define CVMX_DEBUG_COP0_CONTEXT                 \
00138     F(cop0.index);                              \
00139     F(cop0.entrylo[0]);                         \
00140     F(cop0.entrylo[1]);                         \
00141     F(cop0.entryhi);                            \
00142     F(cop0.pagemask);                           \
00143     F(cop0.status);                             \
00144     F(cop0.badvaddr);                           \
00145     F(cop0.cause);                              \
00146     F(cop0.config[0]);              \
00147     F(cop0.config[1]);              \
00148     F(cop0.config[2]);              \
00149     F(cop0.config[3]);              \
00150     F(cop0.depc);                               \
00151     F(cop0.desave);                             \
00152     F(cop0.debug);                              \
00153     F(cop0.multicoredebug);                     \
00154     F(cop0.perfval[0]);                         \
00155     F(cop0.perfval[1]);                         \
00156     F(cop0.perfctrl[0]);                        \
00157     F(cop0.perfctrl[1]);
00158 
00159     struct {
00160         uint64_t fir;
00161         uint64_t fcsr;
00162         } cop1;
00163 
00164 #define CVMX_DEBUG_COP1_CONTEXT                 \
00165     F(cop1.fir);                            \
00166     F(cop1.fcsr);                           
00167 
00168     struct {
00169         uint64_t status;
00170         uint64_t address[4];
00171         uint64_t address_mask[4];
00172         uint64_t asid[4];
00173         uint64_t control[4];
00174     } hw_ibp, hw_dbp;
00175 
00176 /* Hardware Instruction Break Point */
00177 
00178 #define CVMX_DEBUG_HW_IBP_CONTEXT       \
00179     F(hw_ibp.status);               \
00180     F(hw_ibp.address[0]);           \
00181     F(hw_ibp.address[1]);           \
00182     F(hw_ibp.address[2]);           \
00183     F(hw_ibp.address[3]);           \
00184     F(hw_ibp.address_mask[0]);          \
00185     F(hw_ibp.address_mask[1]);          \
00186     F(hw_ibp.address_mask[2]);          \
00187     F(hw_ibp.address_mask[3]);          \
00188     F(hw_ibp.asid[0]);              \
00189     F(hw_ibp.asid[1]);              \
00190     F(hw_ibp.asid[2]);              \
00191     F(hw_ibp.asid[3]);              \
00192     F(hw_ibp.control[0]);           \
00193     F(hw_ibp.control[1]);           \
00194     F(hw_ibp.control[2]);           \
00195     F(hw_ibp.control[3]);
00196 
00197 /* Hardware Data Break Point */
00198 #define CVMX_DEBUG_HW_DBP_CONTEXT       \
00199     F(hw_dbp.status);               \
00200     F(hw_dbp.address[0]);           \
00201     F(hw_dbp.address[1]);           \
00202     F(hw_dbp.address[2]);           \
00203     F(hw_dbp.address[3]);           \
00204     F(hw_dbp.address_mask[0]);          \
00205     F(hw_dbp.address_mask[1]);          \
00206     F(hw_dbp.address_mask[2]);          \
00207     F(hw_dbp.address_mask[3]);          \
00208     F(hw_dbp.asid[0]);              \
00209     F(hw_dbp.asid[1]);              \
00210     F(hw_dbp.asid[2]);              \
00211     F(hw_dbp.asid[3]);              \
00212     F(hw_dbp.control[0]);           \
00213     F(hw_dbp.control[1]);           \
00214     F(hw_dbp.control[2]);           \
00215     F(hw_dbp.control[3]);
00216 
00217     struct cvmx_debug_tlb_t {
00218         uint64_t entryhi;
00219         uint64_t pagemask;
00220         uint64_t entrylo[2];
00221         uint64_t reserved;
00222     } tlbs[CVMX_DEBUG_N_TLB_ENTRIES];
00223 
00224 #define CVMX_DEBUG_TLB_CONTEXT                          \
00225     {   int i;                                          \
00226         for (i = 0; i < CVMX_DEBUG_N_TLB_ENTRIES; i++)  \
00227         {                                               \
00228             F(tlbs[i].entryhi);                         \
00229             F(tlbs[i].pagemask);                        \
00230             F(tlbs[i].entrylo[0]);                      \
00231             F(tlbs[i].entrylo[1]);                      \
00232         }                                               \
00233     }
00234 
00235 } cvmx_debug_core_context_t;
00236 
00237 typedef struct cvmx_debug_tlb_t cvmx_debug_tlb_t;
00238 
00239 typedef enum cvmx_debug_comm_type_e {
00240     COMM_UART,
00241     COMM_REMOTE,
00242     COMM_SIZE
00243 } cvmx_debug_comm_type_t;
00244 
00245 typedef enum {
00246     COMMAND_NOT_CONTROLED = 0,
00247     COMMAND_NOP,        /**< Core doesn't need to do anything. Just stay in exception handler */
00248     COMMAND_STEP,       /**< Core needs to perform a single instruction step */
00249     COMMAND_CONTINUE,    /**< Core need to start running. Doesn't return until some debug event occurs */
00250     COMMAND_NOT_FOCUS
00251             /**< The focus core changed */
00252 } cvmx_debug_command_t;
00253 
00254 /* Every field in this struct has to be uint64_t. */
00255 typedef struct {
00256     uint64_t known_cores;
00257     uint64_t step_isr;
00258                 /**< True if we are going to step into ISR's. */
00259     uint64_t focus_switch;
00260                 /**< Focus can be switched. */
00261     uint64_t core_finished;
00262                 /**< True if a core has finished and not been processed yet.  */
00263     uint64_t command;
00264                 /**< Command for all cores (cvmx_debug_command_t) */
00265     uint64_t step_all;
00266                 /**< True if step and continue should affect all cores. False, only the focus core is affected */
00267     uint64_t focus_core;
00268                 /**< Core currently under control of the debugger */
00269     uint64_t active_cores;
00270                 /**< Bitmask of cores that should stop on a breakpoint */
00271     uint64_t handler_cores;
00272                 /**< Bitmask of cores currently running the exception handler */
00273     uint64_t ever_been_in_debug;
00274                     /**< True if we have been ever been in the debugger stub at all.  */
00275 } __attribute__ ((aligned(sizeof(uint64_t)))) cvmx_debug_state_t;
00276 
00277 typedef int cvmx_debug_state_t_should_fit_inside_a_cache_block[sizeof(cvmx_debug_state_t) + sizeof(cvmx_spinlock_t) + 4 * sizeof(uint64_t) > 128 ? -1 : 1];
00278 
00279 typedef struct cvmx_debug_globals_s {
00280     uint64_t version;   /* This is always the first element of this struct */
00281     uint64_t comm_type; /* cvmx_debug_comm_type_t */
00282     volatile uint64_t comm_changed; /* cvmx_debug_comm_type_t+1 when someone wants to change it. */
00283     volatile uint64_t init_complete;
00284     uint64_t tlb_entries;
00285     uint64_t state[sizeof(cvmx_debug_state_t) / sizeof(uint64_t)];
00286     cvmx_spinlock_t lock;
00287     uint32_t pad;
00288 
00289     volatile cvmx_debug_core_context_t contextes[CVMX_MAX_CORES];
00290 } cvmx_debug_globals_t;
00291 
00292 typedef union {
00293     uint64_t u64;
00294     struct {
00295         uint64_t rsrvd:32;
00296                 /**< Unused */
00297         uint64_t dbd:1;
00298                 /**< Indicates whether the last debug exception or
00299                                     exception in Debug Mode occurred in a branch or
00300                                     jump delay slot */
00301         uint64_t dm:1;
00302                 /**< Indicates that the processor is operating in Debug
00303                                     Mode: */
00304         uint64_t nodcr:1;
00305                 /**< Indicates whether the dseg segment is present */
00306         uint64_t lsnm:1;
00307                 /**< Controls access of loads/stores between the dseg
00308                                     segment and remaining memory when the dseg
00309                                     segment is present */
00310         uint64_t doze:1;
00311                 /**< Indicates that the processor was in a low-power mode
00312                                     when a debug exception occurred */
00313         uint64_t halt:1;
00314                 /**< Indicates that the internal processor system bus clock
00315                                     was stopped when the debug exception occurred */
00316         uint64_t countdm:1;
00317                 /**< Controls or indicates the Count register behavior in
00318                                     Debug Mode. Implementations can have fixed
00319                                     behavior, in which case this bit is read-only (R), or
00320                                     the implementation can allow this bit to control the
00321                                     behavior, in which case this bit is read/write (R/W).
00322                                     The reset value of this bit indicates the behavior after
00323                                     reset, and depends on the implementation.
00324                                     Encoding of the bit is:
00325                                     - 0      Count register stopped in Debug Mode Count register is running in Debug
00326                                     - 1      Mode
00327                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not implemented. */
00328         uint64_t ibusep:1;
00329                 /**< Indicates if a Bus Error exception is pending from an
00330                                     instruction fetch. Set when an instruction fetch bus
00331                                     error event occurs or a 1 is written to the bit by
00332                                     software. Cleared when a Bus Error exception on an
00333                                     instruction fetch is taken by the processor. If IBusEP
00334                                     is set when IEXI is cleared, a Bus Error exception on
00335                                     an instruction fetch is taken by the processor, and
00336                                     IBusEP is cleared.
00337                                     In Debug Mode, a Bus Error exception applies to a
00338                                     Debug Mode Bus Error exception.
00339                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00340                                     implemented. */
00341         uint64_t mcheckp:1;
00342                 /**< Indicates if a Machine Check exception is pending.
00343                                     Set when a machine check event occurs or a 1 is
00344                                     written to the bit by software. Cleared when a
00345                                     Machine Check exception is taken by the processor.
00346                                     If MCheckP is set when IEXI is cleared, a Machine
00347                                     Check exception is taken by the processor, and
00348                                     MCheckP is cleared.
00349                                     In Debug Mode, a Machine Check exception applies
00350                                     to a Debug Mode Machine Check exception.
00351                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00352                                     implemented. */
00353         uint64_t cacheep:1;
00354                 /**< Indicates if a Cache Error is pending. Set when a
00355                                     cache error event occurs or a 1 is written to the bit by
00356                                     software. Cleared when a Cache Error exception is
00357                                     taken by the processor. If CacheEP is set when IEXI
00358                                     is cleared, a Cache Error exception is taken by the
00359                                     processor, and CacheEP is cleared.
00360                                     In Debug Mode, a Cache Error exception applies to a
00361                                     Debug Mode Cache Error exception.
00362                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00363                                     implemented. */
00364         uint64_t dbusep:1;
00365                 /**< Indicates if a Data Access Bus Error exception is
00366                                     pending. Set when a data access bus error event
00367                                     occurs or a 1 is written to the bit by software. Cleared
00368                                     when a Bus Error exception on data access is taken by
00369                                     the processor. If DBusEP is set when IEXI is cleared,
00370                                     a Bus Error exception on data access is taken by the
00371                                     processor, and DBusEP is cleared.
00372                                     In Debug Mode, a Bus Error exception applies to a
00373                                     Debug Mode Bus Error exception.
00374                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00375                                     implemented. */
00376         uint64_t iexi:1;
00377                 /**< An Imprecise Error eXception Inhibit (IEXI) controls
00378                                     exceptions taken due to imprecise error indications.
00379                                     Set when the processor takes a debug exception or an
00380                                     exception in Debug Mode occurs. Cleared by
00381                                     execution of the DERET instruction. Otherwise
00382                                     modifiable by Debug Mode software.
00383                                     When IEXI is set, then the imprecise error exceptions
00384                                     from bus errors on instruction fetches or data
00385                                     accesses, cache errors, or machine checks are
00386                                     inhibited and deferred until the bit is cleared.
00387                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00388                                     implemented. */
00389         uint64_t ddbsimpr:1;
00390                 /**< Indicates that a Debug Data Break Store Imprecise
00391                                     exception due to a store was the cause of the debug
00392                                     exception, or that an imprecise data hardware break
00393                                     due to a store was indicated after another debug
00394                                     exception occurred. Cleared on exception in Debug
00395                                     Mode.
00396                                         - 0 No match of an imprecise data hardware breakpoint on store
00397                                         - 1 Match of imprecise data hardware breakpoint on store
00398                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00399                                     implemented. */
00400         uint64_t ddblimpr:1;
00401                 /**< Indicates that a Debug Data Break Load Imprecise
00402                                     exception due to a load was the cause of the debug
00403                                     exception, or that an imprecise data hardware break
00404                                     due to a load was indicated after another debug
00405                                     exception occurred. Cleared on exception in Debug
00406                                     Mode.
00407                                         - 0 No match of an imprecise data hardware breakpoint on load
00408                                         - 1 Match of imprecise data hardware breakpoint on load
00409                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00410                                     implemented. */
00411         uint64_t ejtagver:3;
00412                 /**< Provides the EJTAG version.
00413                                         - 0      Version 1 and 2.0
00414                                         - 1      Version 2.5
00415                                         - 2      Version 2.6
00416                                         - 3-7    Reserved */
00417         uint64_t dexccode:5;
00418                 /**< Indicates the cause of the latest exception in Debug
00419                                     Mode.
00420                                     The field is encoded as the ExcCode field in the
00421                                     Cause register for those exceptions that can occur in
00422                                     Debug Mode (the encoding is shown in MIPS32 and
00423                                     MIPS64 specifications), with addition of code 30
00424                                     with the mnemonic CacheErr for cache errors and the
00425                                     use of code 9 with mnemonic Bp for the SDBBP
00426                                     instruction.
00427                                     This value is undefined after a debug exception. */
00428         uint64_t nosst:1;
00429                 /**< Indicates whether the single-step feature controllable
00430                                     by the SSt bit is available in this implementation:
00431                                           - 0      Single-step feature available
00432                                           - 1      No single-step feature available
00433                                     A minimum number of hardware instruction
00434                                     breakpoints must be available if no single-step
00435                                     feature is implemented in hardware. Refer to Section
00436                                     4.8.1 on page 69 for more information. */
00437         uint64_t sst:1;
00438                 /**< Controls whether single-step feature is enabled:
00439                                           - 0       No enable of single-step feature
00440                                           - 1       Single-step feature enabled
00441                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00442                                     implemented due to no single-step feature (NoSSt is
00443                                     1). */
00444         uint64_t rsrvd2:2;
00445                 /**< Must be zero */
00446         uint64_t dint:1;
00447                 /**< Indicates that a Debug Interrupt exception occurred.
00448                                     Cleared on exception in Debug Mode.
00449                                           - 0       No Debug Interrupt exception
00450                                           - 1       Debug Interrupt exception
00451                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00452                                     implemented. */
00453         uint64_t dib:1;
00454                 /**< Indicates that a Debug Instruction Break exception
00455                                     occurred. Cleared on exception in Debug Mode.
00456                                           - 0       No Debug Instruction Break exception
00457                                           - 1       Debug Instruction Break exception
00458                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00459                                     implemented. */
00460         uint64_t ddbs:1;
00461                 /**< Indicates that a Debug Data Break Store exception
00462                                     occurred on a store due to a precise data hardware
00463                                     break. Cleared on exception in Debug Mode.
00464                                           - 0       No Debug Data Break Store Exception
00465                                           - 1       Debug Data Break Store Exception
00466                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00467                                     implemented. */
00468         uint64_t ddbl:1;
00469                 /**< Indicates that a Debug Data Break Load exception
00470                                     occurred on a load due to a precise data hardware
00471                                     break. Cleared on exception in Debug Mode.
00472                                           - 0       No Debug Data Break Store Exception
00473                                           - 1       Debug Data Break Store Exception
00474                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00475                                     implemented. */
00476         uint64_t dbp:1;
00477                 /**< Indicates that a Debug Breakpoint exception
00478                                     occurred. Cleared on exception in Debug Mode.
00479                                           - 0      No Debug Breakpoint exception
00480                                           - 1      Debug Breakpoint exception */
00481         uint64_t dss:1;
00482                 /**< Indicates that a Debug Single Step exception
00483                                     occurred. Cleared on exception in Debug Mode.
00484                                           - 0       No debug single-step exception
00485                                           - 1       Debug single-step exception
00486                                     This bit is read-only (R) and reads as zero if not
00487                                     implemented. */
00488     } s;
00489 } cvmx_debug_register_t;
00490 
00491 typedef struct {
00492     void (*init) (void);
00493     void (*install_break_handler) (void);
00494     int needs_proxy;
00495     int (*getpacket) (char *, size_t);
00496     int (*putpacket) (char *);
00497     int (*wait_for_resume) (volatile cvmx_debug_core_context_t *);
00498     void (*change_core) (int, int);
00499 } cvmx_debug_comm_t;
